t: Brand Unknown A Brand Register Seller
s: do you use GS1 codes? If so, are these registered to your brand? If you just bought the codes on GS1, it takes few days for GS1 to report these to Amazon and for Amazon to adapt this information. Until then, codes are recognised by Amazon as unknown brand, so that could be your problem.

t: Pukemark, Sweatyrocks, Demonlick: Made-for-Amazon Brand Names Are Getting Ridiculously Surreal
s: October 14, 2020 - It’s common to come across unfamiliar brands on Amazon, where sellers are constantly fashioning product lines and whole brands around what shoppers are searching for. But here were a series of names that were not only unknown to me, but also quite perplexing: Artfish, Wishpig, Sweatyrocks, ...

t: Brand name shows as "unknown"
s: I am brand registered and GTIN exempt yet every time I go to try to list my first product in seller central and I list my brand name exactly as it is registered then hit save, then when I look at my listing as it will show on Amazon just under the title it shows brand name: “Unknown” Seems ...

t: r/NoStupidQuestions on Reddit: Why does Amazon sell unknown (probably not real) brands of basic stuff that cost an absolute fortune?
Amazon (AMZN) owns a whole collection of secret brands, USPTO trademark filings reveal
s: July 20, 2022 - You've probably been buying way more things from Amazon than you realize.

t: Why does Amazon carry a lot of brands that I have never heard of? - Quora
s: Answer (1 of 6): A lot of entrepreneurs and new product ideas (or modified ones) are sold on Amazon. It is a great way to get your product in front of millions of eyes. Also, as others have said, a lot of the gadget-type products are from China…..and have all sorts of strange brand names.

t: List of Amazon brands - Wikipedia
s: November 26, 2024 - Amazon offers multiple lines of privately labeled products. These are available on Amazon.com, Amazon Fresh, Prime Pantry, Prime Now, Amazon Go, and Whole Foods Market. Amazon houses its in-house brand offerings under the “Our Brands” label, which is separate from exclusive brands.

t: Amazon's in-house brands are quietly taking over the site
s: June 26, 2018 - Since the Amazon marketplace is filled with countless inexpensive, largely anonymous brands — like Yungsong and Qianxiang for iPhone cables — Amazon’s often similarly priced offerings stand out. Unlike the unknown brands, Amazon’s products are backed by a large, established company ...
